member.name: T:Zebble.Chart.Function
member.summary: Represents a line series that generates its dataset from a function.
member.remarks: Define f(x) and make a plot on the range [x0,x1] or define x(t) and y(t) and make a plot on the range [t0,t1].

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using functions x(t) and y(t).

member.name: T:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap
member.summary: Represents a heat map.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap.X0
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the elements at index [0,*] in the data set.
member.value: If equals , the value defines the mid point of the element at index [0,*] in the data set. If equals , the value defines the coordinate of the left edge of the element at index [0,*] in the data set.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap.X1
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the mid point for the elements at index [m-1,*] in the data set.
member.value: If equals , the value defines the mid point of the element at index [m-1,*] in the data set. If equals , the value defines the coordinate of the right edge of the element at index [m-1,*] in the data set.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap.Y0
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the mid point for the elements at index [*,0] in the data set.
member.value: If equals , the value defines the mid point of the element at index [*,0] in the data set. If equals , the value defines the coordinate of the bottom edge of the element at index [*,0] in the data set.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap.Y1
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the mid point for the elements at index [*,n-1] in the data set.
member.value: If equals , the value defines the mid point of the element at index [*,n-1] in the data set. If equals , the value defines the coordinate of the top edge of the element at index [*,n-1] in the data set.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data array.
member.remarks: Note that the indices of the data array refer to [x,y]. The first dimension is along the x-axis. The second dimension is along the y-axis. Remember to call the method if the contents of the array is changed.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap.Interpolate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to interpolate when rendering. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This property is not supported on all platforms. Ignored (off) if is .

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap.CoordinateDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets the coordinate definition. The default value is .

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.HeatMap.RenderMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the render method. The default value is .

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.Line.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the curve.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.Series.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the series. The default is null.
member.value: The title that is shown in the legend of the plot. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.TwoColorArea.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets a baseline for the series.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.TwoColorLine.Color2
member.summary: Gets or sets the color for the part of the line that is below the limit.

member.name: P:Zebble.Chart.TwoColorLine.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets the limit.
member.remarks: The parts of the line that is below this limit will be rendered with Color2. The parts of the line that is above the limit will be rendered with Color.
